I condemn Putin's authoritarian actions in Ukraine and stand with the Ukrainian people. 

We must do everything in our power to find a diplomatic solution. If Putin does not respond to diplomacy, the U.S. must be ready to provide humanitarian aid to Ukrainian refugees.
@MannyFarooqi @SocialSecurity @GovMurphy @uzzimma Messaging you now.

In honor of #BlackHistoryMonth, @TheBlackCaucus and @JECDems released new analysis of the economic status of Black Americans. The report celebrates decades' worth of progress while recognizing the long road ahead.

#JECxCBC

These projects are merely 2 examples among many of what‚Äôs possible when the fed and local govts team up with experienced companies like @advancedsolarpr to put this technology into action - diversifying & securing our electrical grid, creating jobs, and protecting our environment https://t.co/kQ81MzMYhe

It's time to invest in child care and lower costs for working families.

Ahmaud Arbery was killed because he was Black. His murder was a modern-day lynching. 

No verdict can bring back Ahmaud. However, I hope the Arbery family is able to find some solace in this ruling today. 

Perpetrators of racist violence must ALWAYS be held accountable. https://t.co/J1N8bsfoQQ

#OTD in 1943, three brave members of the White Rose Movement were put to death in Germany for calling for resistance to the brutality of the Nazi regime.

Their bravery serves as a reminder that fighting antisemitism and hate are everyones responsibility.

https://t.co/Zed3UrnqAC

The expanded Child Tax Credit worked.

There is no reason not to bring it back. https://t.co/cAPLUYjS67

Every Senator opposing Build Back Better is actively choosing to turn their backs on America's most vulnerable. https://t.co/702bTWlHsY

Buildings with fire sprinklers had a civilian fire death rate 88% lower and an injury rate 28% lower. Additionally, the rate of firefighter injuries was 78% lower compared to homes without sprinklers.

My Public Housing Fire Safety Act and the High-Rise Fire Sprinkler Incentive Act introduced by @BillPascrell  are bipartisan and bicameral. They would increase the use of sprinklers in multi-family homes.

Today, I lead a letter to House and Senate Leadership calling for immediate consideration of 2 important pieces of legislation that would help prevent the kinds of fires we've seen recently in The Bronx and Philadelphia that killed 29, including 17 children. https://t.co/KVUQdTYaz8

The expanded Child Tax Credit was one of the most successful anti-poverty policies in our nation's history. These payments kept kids and their families out of poverty.

Bringing the CTC back shouldn't even be up for debate. https://t.co/MTvxbqQuoK

@JakeSherman @united This the same Cruz who argued that unruly passengers who threaten airline employees shouldn't be put on no-fly lists? 
ü§î

In @POTUS's first year in office, New Jersey added 13,400 manufacturing jobs.

This is what investing in workers looks like.

Corporations have taken advantage of a public health crisis to drive up prices. They're hurting society's most vulnerable ‚Äî the working class ‚Äî for the sake of profit. That's immoral. 

It's not inflation, it's corporate greed. And it's time to hold corporations accountable. https://t.co/ACQULJ0Gmi

We can afford Build Back Better *four times over.*

We can choose to invest in working families, or we can once again choose to leave them behind.

Let's make the right choice. https://t.co/I9OWZlfiW3

Dr. Cook is one of our nation's brightest and most accomplished economists. 

By not showing up to her confirmation hearing, @SenateGOP is showing that they cannot face the prospect of a Black woman in power.

Seriously, WHAT is going on with the @SenateGOP? 
First, they argue unruly passengers are good for air travel, and now a woman who helped prevent the execution of innocent people is responsible for increased carjacking rates? https://t.co/e2yAE7vjew

The GOP's boycott of the Banking Committee prevents her from working on some of the most pressing economical challenges facing the nation. 
Continued delay of her consideration is unacceptable. https://t.co/e98qHNveUp

Most Americans agree ‚Äî corporate greed hurts everyone except those at the very top.

We need to hold corporations and the rich accountable. It's time for them to finally pay their fair share. It's time to invest in workers. https://t.co/DHPm2gT88h
Tax. The. Rich. https://t.co/UDmWcmVf8J

"If there is no struggle, there is no progress."

Born into slavery, abolitionist Frederick Douglass marked February 14, 1818 as his birthday. Like many enslaved Black people, he never knew his actual birthday.

#BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/Z05PL1KOU7

This #ValentinesDay, Democrats have a love note for workers, families and the planet. It's called the Build Back Better Act, and it includes historic funding for affordable, sustainable housing. 

Housing is a human right ‚Äî it's time to #ShowHousingLove and pass BBB. https://t.co/2ILftHTJHw

Prices are rising, and rising prices hurt.

As for the cause of those rising prices? It's *not* investments in the working class. It's corporate greed, pure and simple.

Tax the rich. Tax corporations. Give workers a fair shake for once. https://t.co/MtXFt05XSD

Four years ago today, the #Parkland shooting killed 17 innocent people. 

Today is the 45th day of 2022. In 2022, there have been 49 recorded mass shootings.

This isn't just a gun violence problem. It's a gun violence epidemic. Congress must pass commonsense gun laws NOW.

On this day in 1909, the @NAACP was founded in New York City.

One of the most influential organizations of its kind, the NAACP has spent 113 years fighting for Black Americans‚Äô civil rights. This #BlackHistoryMonth, I thank them for all the progress they made possible. https://t.co/3jLtF6i7QG

If you're in public service to make a quick buck, you're in it for the wrong reasons. Banning Members from insider trading is a crucial step toward getting corruption out of Congress.

A legislator's job is to serve the people, not line their own pockets. https://t.co/CVUgX9iDn4

Discriminating against Black hair is race-based discrimination. According to the Civil Rights Act of 1964, that should be illegal.

Unfortunately, hair discrimination is still far too common. I reintroduced the CROWN Act to end it for good. 

Natural hair belongs everywhere. https://t.co/60Szw0lD7W

Once again, @HouseDemocrats are delivering for the American people. Thanks to the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, we're #ElectrifyingAmerica by providing $15,448,790 for New Jersey to invest in charging infrastructure for electric vehicles. https://t.co/t0br0Na1BF

@rocohen_ the PRO Act does a number of things including beefing up enforcement of existing laws which are routinely violated.

There isn't a "labor shortage."

There's a living wage shortage.
There's a benefits shortage.
There's a workers' rights shortage.

If corporations want a higher labor supply, maybe they should treat workers with the basic human decency they deserve. 
https://t.co/0QpvYhFl6Q

Starbucks workers across the country are taking steps to unionize, including my local Starbucks. 

They all deserve a fair process without interference from their bosses. 

It's time the Senate pass the #PROAct and finally guarantee workers their right to organize. https://t.co/WnjNXkh7w7
Princeton student @ChloeKim is bringing home the gold to #NJ12! https://t.co/2PjQhTj8Nc

The Black soldiers who fought for our nation's independence have been wiped from the historical record. I've introduced bipartisan legislation to formally honor them.

Black history cannot be erased from American history.
https://t.co/lob1BAfHmT

Decorated Continental Army soldier Oliver Cromwell crossed the Delaware with George Washington, yet his achievements have largely been erased because he was Black. At long last, he will be officially commemorated in New Jersey. 
https://t.co/mOsDkYScaU

Congressional staffers keep our country running. They, like every worker in America, deserve a union.

Alongside @RepAndyLevin and 129 Democratic colleagues, I'm proud to cosponsor this resolution that would protect staffers' fundamental right to organize.
https://t.co/tZDWvV7hYL

Recently, Republicans have taken to labeling certain policies ‚Äî including public health measures like mask mandates ‚Äî ‚ÄúOrwellian.‚Äù 

Orwell‚Äôs "1984" portrays an authoritarian dystopia in which knowledge itself is policed. 

This is authoritarian behavior. https://t.co/0GPLU7F85A

Support your local pizzeria!

Kevin... it's the *Winter* Olympics that are happening this year. The 100-meter dash is a *summer* event. No need to start training now.

Instead, I'd suggest answering reporters' questions about your party's embrace of domestic terrorism. https://t.co/uZS3MqTrky

What we're seeing is domestic terrorism against the nation's black youth, targeting students while school districts across the country seek to erase black history.
We can't wash away the sins of our nation's past, and those who refuse to learn our history are doomed to repeat it. https://t.co/ixkaYCTrzF
@RepBeatty @RepHalRogers Disgusting behavior @RepHalRogers

I'd like to thank @HIVHep, @HRC, @NASTAD and @AIDSInstitute for calling on the President to support a national PrEP grant program.

We have the tools to end HIV/AIDS for good. Now, we just have to get those tools to the communities that need them.

Last year, we saw record job growth... without student loan payments. These payments are not necessary to keep our economy going.

@POTUS ‚Äî you have the power to make historic progress toward racial and economic justice. It's time to use that power and #CancelStudentDebt. https://t.co/6B8MlLhVJD

In honor of #SaferInternetDay, I'm joining @RepSusanWild in demanding that @YouTube take down dangerous "How to Tie a Noose" videos.

Social media companies play an outsized role in our children's lives and must do their part to curtail the youth suicide crisis.

Starting this summer, New Jerseyans struggling with suicidal thoughts will be able to talk with trained mental health professionals by dialing 988.

Until then, know that help is still available. 

National Suicide Prevention Lifeline: 1-800-237-8255 
https://t.co/8Pmo2pp7VA

I lived through the Watergate scandal. This is precisely the sort of action that made the name "Nixon" synonymous with corruption.

When prominent Republicans bow to kiss Trump's ring, they enable and encourage this behavior. https://t.co/Dx7OluvDbq

Congratulations to Dr. Michael Lindsey for being named Dean of NYU's Silver School of Social Work! Dr. Lindsey chaired the working group for my Emergency Taskforce on Black Youth Suicide and Mental Health.

My thoughts are with the Mullen family as they endure the unimaginable trauma of losing a loved one.

A New Jersey native, Navy Seaman Kyle Mullen was only 24. May he rest in peace. https://t.co/WyUvq1pCq6

Today is National Black HIV/AIDS Awareness Day.

Black people suffer from HIV/AIDS at disproportionately high rates. To change that, we must address HIV stigma and structural barriers to care. Ending HIV/AIDS isn't just a health issue ‚Äî it's a racial justice issue.

Climate action can't wait. Our future depends on it. 

We need to keep polluter interests out of politics. We need to finally put planet over profit. We need a Green New Deal. https://t.co/gWEJgseoQC

From apartment leases to apps' terms and conditions, forced arbitration clauses are everywhere. 

We can't let these clauses stop sexual assault survivors from telling their stories. I'm proud to support the #EndForcedArbitration Act and put the power in survivors‚Äô hands.

Today, I joined 120 @HouseDemocrats demanding the repeal of Trump‚Äôs #DirtyWaterRule, the biggest attack on clean water in recent history. 

Clean water is a human right, and I'll fight to ensure that right is protected for generations to come.
This Black History Month, the GOP is trying to ban the teaching of Black history. Let that sink in. https://t.co/TuGUOEdYPq

Trayvon Martin should be turning 27 years old today. But ten years ago, racist violence cut his life tragically short.

I will never stop fighting for a future where Black children like Trayvon can live, play and grow up without fearing for their lives.

#BlackLivesMatter. https://t.co/YJl00KI0ph

To the GOP, domestic terrorism is "legitimate political discourse."

We cannot allow a major political party to whitewash a violent attack on the very nation it claims to serve. 
https://t.co/qV8pfln4gi

More than half of Family and Medical Leave Act leaves are for personal medical leave, and they're unpaid. The #FMLA has been a landmark protection for 29 years, but workers deserve more.

Workers deserve an expanded FMLA. Workers deserve #PaidLeave.

The Biden recovery plan is *still* working. 

But getting people back to work isn't the end. We must keep fighting for paid leave, a $15 federal minimum wage and other essential investments in the working class. https://t.co/rk5DdDYOgw

Happy birthday to Rosa Parks, the first lady of the civil rights movement. She would have been 109 today.

Her act of civil disobedience sparked a decades-long fight for racial justice that continues to this day.

I am forever grateful for her sacrifice. https://t.co/iM49aDNNhV

Congressional staffers put in long hours helping constituents and crafting legislation.
They, like all workers, deserve respect and a safe work environment. 
If they want a union. I‚Äôll make sure they have the opportunity to do so. https://t.co/IcWuoA2xDT

New Jersey residents ‚Äî the New Jersey Earned Income Tax Credit is a benefit that puts money right back into your pocket. You can see if you're eligible at https://t.co/2z7yUheCL5.

The #AmericaCOMPETES Act invests $45 billion to fix our nation‚Äôs supply chains, prevent shortages of critical goods and ensure more of them are made right here in the United States. This investment will both meet the current moment and support workers post-pandemic.

Take a moment today to read @HannahDrake628's important message here:

"...I am challenging Black women to reclaim you. Reclaim yourself. Find your peace and your center. Reclaim the true meaning of self-care before the world took it and commercialized it..."

History has erased the Black and Indigenous soldiers who fought in the American Revolution. I joined @NRDems to discuss my National Liberty Memorial Preservation Act, which would establish a memorial to honor the soldiers of color who were crucial in securing our independence. https://t.co/nkVtOqFO7E

During a pandemic, the richest country on Earth refuses to guarantee paid medical leave. Let that sink in.

Working families deserve so much better. https://t.co/lhNBPKq2p0

We can afford Build Back Better ‚Äî four times over, as a matter of fact.

For the lawmakers who opposed the bill, affordability was never *really* the issue. For them, protecting special interests was worth the cost of hurting working families.

The rich must pay their fair share. https://t.co/qV08bXo9EM

Investing in child care helps parents, kids and the economy. 

As public servants, it is our moral imperative to support working people. We cannot continue be the only country in the developed world that leaves these families behind. https://t.co/nOlSU7ShOM

Domestic terrorism has no place on campus or anywhere else in the country.

Read my statement on the recent bomb threats against HBCUs: https://t.co/s8dLDWomov

Friendly reminder: Critical race theory is a complex academic school of thought. It's the type of thing you might study in college or grad school. 

K-12 schools are not teaching critical race theory. They're teaching history. The GOP is trying to ban the teaching of HISTORY. https://t.co/TMdA0xhsZu
There's a well-known Senate procedure that has often been used to slow down and block the passage of voting and civil rights legislation. It rhymes with "billibuster." https://t.co/wptTUGIAGP

Today, I will join @RepNikema and over 360 fellow co-sponsors in voting to pass #HR5577 to name the John R. Lewis Post Office. 

Congressman Lewis was a friend and personal hero of mine. I‚Äôm proud to honor his legacy and continue his fight for justice in Congress.

When Black women and girls go missing, their cases often don't get the attention or resources they deserve. This Saturday, Feb. 5th, join @CBWGCAUCUS for Not My Girls, a virtual discussion on the need for increased awareness of this issue. 

RSVP at https://t.co/DIUgNcvwKo. https://t.co/5RmYhHpfyE

Students have a right to feel safe on campus. 

It is unacceptable that HBCUs across the country are receiving bomb threats ‚Äî on the first day of #BlackHistoryMonth, no less. My thoughts are with the affected students and faculty.
https://t.co/uHyGVRGq9Y
In honor of this Year of the Tiger, join me in wishing everybody a fearless and courageous #LunarNewYear as we work to advance legislation to make #LNY a federal holiday.
Great way to start Black History Month Ted. üôÑ
I'd love to know how many Black women @SenTedCruz consulted before he decided he was qualified to speak on our behalf. https://t.co/U49BfCGuEE

This #BlackHistoryMonth, celebrate how far our nation has come, but acknowledge how far we need to go. And remember ‚Äî Black history is not just for the month of February. Black history is American history. (16/16)

In 1967, Dr. King asked, ‚ÄúWhere do we go from here?‚Äù 

I have some suggestions...

I encourage the next generation of civic leaders to pick up where my generation leaves off. Advocate. Organize. Run for office! And keep the faith. (15/16)

The history of Black America is a history of struggle. Present-day Black America is rife with struggle. 

However, I‚Äôm optimistic that the future of Black America will be different. (14/16)
^^^ THAT is why it‚Äôs more important than ever that we don‚Äôt give up. (13/16)

But history has taught us that progress is never without obstruction. 

Today, Jim Crow lives on through Republican efforts to suppress voting. If their war on democracy reaches its logical conclusion, we stand to lose decades of progress toward racial justice. (12/16)

Last year, I reintroduced the CROWN Act, which would ban discrimination based on traditionally Black hairstyles, including locs, cornrows, twists, braids, Bantu knots and Afros. Nobody should be discriminated against based on how their hair grows out of their head. (11/16)

I co-founded the @CBWGCAUCUS with @RepYvetteClarke and @RepRobinKelly. Together, we‚Äôre speaking out against the structural inequities that Black women face and fighting for a future where Black girls have the same opportunities to thrive as everyone else. (10/16)
In the meantime, I‚Äôm fighting alongside my fellow Black Members of Congress to pass legislation that takes the needs of the Black community seriously. (9/16)

To be Black ‚Äî and specifically, a Black woman ‚Äî in America is to be underappreciated, underestimated and underrepresented.

That will only change when our country‚Äôs institutions actually look like the people they serve. On that front, we have a long road ahead. (8/16)
The racist backlash was immediate, with prominent conservatives suggesting that to be a ‚Äúqualified‚Äù nominee and to be a Black woman were somehow mutually exclusive. (7/16)

The Biden Administration has made efforts to create a more representative government. 

Most recently, the President has announced that he will nominate the first Black woman to the #SCOTUS. (6/16)

More than 12% of our country‚Äôs population is Black. 

Yet our nation‚Äôs history, we have had only two Black #SCOTUS Justices, both of whom were men.

The Supreme Court‚Äôs decisions affect EVERY American. Diverse perspectives on that bench are a must. (5/16)

America prides itself on being a representative democracy. However, a representative government must truly *represent* the people it serves. 

As it stands now, this is not the case. (4/16)

Our nation is still governed overwhelmingly by the white, the male and the wealthy. Our leaders in the federal government make decisions for the entire country, including those whose lived experiences are nothing like their own. (3/16)

In 1967, #MLK wrote, ‚ÄúThe roots of racism are very deep in America. Historically, it was so acceptable in the national life that today it still only lightly burdens the conscience.‚Äù

Despite our progress as a country, Dr. King‚Äôs words ring true 55 years later. (2/16)

Today is the first day of #BlackHistoryMonth. 

Racism is still entrenched in the fabric of American society. 

I‚Äôm optimistic for a future where it isn‚Äôt. But the road to that future is a long and challenging one. (1/16) https://t.co/EqLnsw6KIM

This week is National Gun Violence Survivors Week.

I'm taking this moment to listen to survivors, support them through their trauma and recommit to my work to end gun violence. 

RT to make your voice heard in our fight to save lives. #GVSurvivorsWeek

Cheslie Kryst‚Äôs death reminds us that the hardest battles we fight are the ones within. My thoughts are with her family.

I commend @POTUS's commitment to elevating qualified Black women to leadership positions in the federal government. https://t.co/vzUEPJRhu6

My thoughts are with all who were affected by this traumatic event.

On #HolocaustRemembranceDay, we remember the more than six million Jewish people who were murdered by the Nazi regime.

We must never forget humanity's past evils. We must all condemn antisemitism, authoritarianism and hatred in all its forms. https://t.co/DYAiwCXw7i

Fighting the climate crisis means curbing emissions from energy production.

As a member of @SEEC's new Power Sector Task Force, I'm joining seven of my House Democratic colleagues to ensure that the government takes the necessary steps to decarbonize our energy sector.

Canceling student debt is social, racial and economic justice. I'm proud to join my House and Senate colleagues in calling on @POTUS to use his existing authority to #CancelStudentDebt. https://t.co/4v2MdhpQ9q

We can't learn the wrong lessons from last year. We can't keep settling for less. We can't give up on #BuildBackBetter.

It's our duty to deliver for the people. https://t.co/eWhrDavzu4

As a member of @LGBTEqCaucus, I will never stop fighting for policies that honor the dignity of transgender Americans.

That's why I joined over 190 of my Democratic colleagues in an amicus brief urging the Court to uphold our right to breathe clean air. https://t.co/zHwFfvDw3d
